CARDINAL . Under LAW of the Pre - trial LAW , during the investigation and trial suspects may be held in a GPE ( temporary detention centre ) or in a prison that serves as a GPE . Exceptionally suspects may be kept in an ORG ( cells for short - term detention in police stations ) . If a convicted person is under investigation in respect of another offence , he or she may be held in the disciplinary detention unit of the correctional colony . LAW provides that suspects who have been convicted of a different offence must be separated from other detainees .

CARDINAL . The Correctional Labour Code provided that a convicted person should normally be held in the same custodial institution ( LAW ) . Under LAW , a person who was sentenced to imprisonment in a colony could be temporarily held in a GPE or prison in connection with different criminal proceedings , as a witness ( for DATE with the authorisation of the prosecutor ) or as a suspect , in accordance with the general rules governing detained suspects under LAW .
CARDINAL . The Code on Enforcement of Criminal Sanctions replaced LAW .
